entry.title: Temporary forever sounds pretty good
entry.summary:
Author: sourwolfdiaz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,508Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: All this time, the team had thought this incident had triggered him, but really it took an equal if not a larger toll on Buck.And Eddie couldn't even gather the courage to comfort him. Does that make him selfish? Not being able to comfort the only person he can focus on, the only one he cares about. There's something stopping from reaching out, maybe his subconscious, maybe a part of him doesn't want to ‚Äì he does, maybe the hurt is too much.¬†Or, Buck and Eddie break up, and try find their way back together

entry.title: Look at the stars, look how they shine for you
entry.summary:
Author: stargazingstormtrooper92

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,808Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 1

Summary: His blue eyes are sparkling under the starry night and are scrunched up in laughter over a story about how a certain constellation got its name. His eyelashes flutter with every blink, the perfect curvature of his nose and lips transfix Eddie and for the first time in a while he let himself feel it. Let it be (...)"If I tell you I love you, do you promise you'll remind me of everything you just said even though you might not feel the same?" (...)(...) "But... I love you more and more each and every time when you actually say what you want and need. So, Eddie. What do you want right now?"***Or: Buck and Eddie go stargazing while Christopher is in Texas. Confessions are made ‚ú®ü™ê

entry.title: The Weather Outside Is Frightful
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 31,271Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 59

Summary: Athena plans a Christmas getaway to celebrate Bobby‚Äôs return, but a booking mix-up leaves Buck and Eddie sharing a two-bedroom cabin‚Ä¶ alone. The rest of the 118 ends up in the bigger cabin (and immediately continues there betting pool), while Chris quietly joins Team ‚ÄúMy Dad and Buck Need to Get Together Before Christmas.‚Äù What follows is a week of accidental couple‚Äôs activities, mistletoe mishaps, disastrous gingerbread houses, Buck teaching Eddie how to ski, snowball fights, and so many almost-moments neither of them will admit to. Buck‚Äôs convinced Eddie‚Äôs straight. Eddie‚Äôs convinced Buck could never want him back.And on Christmas Eve, when a storm traps them in their cabin, they finally have no choice but to talk about everything they‚Äôve been avoiding. A holiday trip, a slow burn, and two idiots in love trying very hard not to be. Or Buck and Eddie get stuck sharing a cabin during the 118‚Äôs Christmas vacation, and every holiday trope in existence decides to attack them at once.By Christmas Eve, the only thing more intense than the snowstorm is the truth they‚Äôve been avoiding.

entry.title: The Shape of Things Falling Apart
entry.summary:
Author: 79_50

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,266Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 18

Summary: After Chris moves in with Buck, Eddie Diaz does what he‚Äôs always done best: he takes control. He plans. He prepares. He makes sure there are no loose ends. Buck watches the man he loves grow quieter, calmer, and terrifyingly resolved, and realises too late that Eddie isn‚Äôt coping. He‚Äôs preparing. This is a story about love, guilt, and what happens when someone decides the best way to protect the people they love is to disappear.

entry.title: I'm Coming, Wait For Me
entry.summary:
Author: Woongwoongie

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,155Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 34

Summary: He‚Äôs been having that issue lately. His control over his emotions is completely out of whack. As though he‚Äôs back to being a teenager, all feelings and no logic. He finds himself crying over spilled milk and catching an attitude with Eddie for trying to make his life easier. And Eddie, who is ever so cruel, doesn‚Äôt even dignify Buck by yelling back. He never judges, never gets angry, never gets frustrated, just always persistent and always stable. This, of course, makes Buck feel awful afterwards, which only makes him even more irritable. A horrible cycle for everyone involved. And yet Eddie does not once complain. So, when he finally does yell back, it really throws Buck for a loop. *** After getting struck by lightning, Buck struggles with his injuries and getting back to normal. Things change between Eddie and Buck as Eddie helps Buck recover while dealing with his own guilt about the situation

entry.title: How To Lose a Firefighter In Ten Days Off
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 67,421Chapters: 15/16Kudos: 85

Summary: He walks past them and sits at the bar to order a round of shots, figuring that coming into the group that way might be a good icebreaker. He hasn‚Äôt ordered yet when he hears behind him, ‚ÄúThanks for the shot.‚Äù he turns to see Captain Diaz standing by him, and Buck is confused ‚ÄúYou're talking to me, Captain Diaz.‚Äù Buck smiles, trying to assess the situation. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Eddie, and yes, you're the only one to buy me a shot.‚Äù He tells him, and Buck smiles. ‚ÄúReally, no one brought you a drink? I am surprised,‚Äù Buck says honestly. ‚ÄúWhy is that, Buck?‚Äù Eddie asks, leaning against the counter. Was this man actually flirting with him? ‚ÄúHave you looked in the mirror, Diaz. Does anyone call you that?" Buck leans in. ‚ÄúNot if they want me to answer.‚Äù Eddie takes a sip of his beer, and Buck can‚Äôt take his eyes off him. ‚ÄúI look in mirrors every day, your point?‚Äù he shrugs and stares back. ‚ÄúYou do know how beautiful you are, right?‚Äù Buck lays the charm on thick. ‚ÄúIs your full name Eduardo?‚Äù ¬† ¬† OR How To Lose A Guy in Ten Days: Firefight Edition- loosely based on it, these two are so in love with each other and can't admit it.

entry.title: Perfectly Imperfect
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_stan

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,403Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 62

Summary: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, do you have a problem with Buck?‚Äù Eddie asks, suddenly feeling protective of him. ‚ÄúNo, he's fine. It‚Äôs just with how much you talk about him, it feels like you should be on this date with him.‚Äù Eddie goes to open his mouth to tell him that that was crazy. He would never date Buck. Buck was his best friend. But then he started to look at Beck. Like really look at him. Once the realization struck him, he felt his mouth go dry. Beck was almost a carbon copy of Buck. They both were really good cooks, they loved fun facts, they‚Äôre both great with kids, they both look alike, and their names are even similar. How did he not see it? or Buck starts spiraling when Eddie dates another man, who is basically a better version of Buck. Eddie realizes his feelings when he's his date says he should date Buck instead. Eddie has to track Buck down before he leaves for Minnesota for his new job opportunity to tell him how he feels

entry.title: Piece By Piece (English Version)
entry.summary:
Author: Pookiebrin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,603Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 370

Summary: Buck had finally understood... it had taken him 3 months, 3 months of silences and angry looks, of orders given coldly and endless lists of tasks at the station, of people leaving when he sat down at the table, of conversations stopping when he arrived.3 months but he had finally understood: Station 118 did not forgive and those he had fought for had turned their backs on him.3 months but it had become clear to him: he was not welcome there and that was not his family, it never had been. And now all that was left was to let go. But a call and a girl who reminds him too much of himself could be the solution to the cold in his life and his heart.
